title: Drawing, "Design for a Verrière (Monteith) with Handle, for Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory, Paris", ca. 1765–75
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor on off-white laid paper
markings: Watermark: D C BLAUW (similiar to Churchill 328)
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, below image: No 10. Seau Crènelée pour contenir verres et liqueurs 120 #; lower left: Anse du dt Seau.
provenance:
From the collection of Giovanni Piancastelli
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Drawing of a verriere in elevation with a fluted rim containing blue and brown (gold toned) bands, with scattered floral clusters. Detail of handle lower left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Verrière (Monteith) with Handle, for Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory, Paris", ca. 1765–75.
ca. 1765–75. Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8316.
